creator: brindusa.tot@softvision.ro
summary: In high contrast theme, selection of one site under "Settings - Cookies and Site Date" dialog is not visible

comments.text:
Created attachment 8955433
HighContrastSettings.png

Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:60.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/60
Build ID 20180301223350

[Affected versions]:
Nightly 60.0a1

[Affected platforms]:
Windows 10 x64, Windows 7 x32

[Steps to reproduce]:
1. Set up your windows with a High Contrast theme (Go to Personalise → Themes → Theme Settings and activate a High Contrast Theme.)
2. Launch Nightly 60.0a1 with a new profile
3. Open few web pages in new tabs (youtube.com, facebook.com, www.wikipedia.org, www.reddit.com)
4. Go to about:preferences#privacy
5. At Cookies and Site Data section click on Settings button.
6. Under the Settings - Cookies and Site Data dialog, select one of the sites from the table.

[Expected results]:
The website should be selected and selection should be visible to the user.

[Actual result]:
The selection is not visible to the end user.(see screenshot)
comments.author: brindusa.tot@softvision.ro

comments.text: This is not a new regression, right?
comments.author: jhofmann@mozilla.com

comments.text:
So, the "Settings - Cookies and Site Data" dialog was introduced with the Site Storage UI Redesign implementation. This is why I did not mention if this is a regression or not.

But if we consider this dialog the next level of "Settings - Site Data" dialog, then this is not a new regression. On the "Settings - Site Data" dialog from an older version of Firefox(57) the behavior is the same.
